result.execSummary:
The defendant Siddique A Qureshi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 151 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DNA Surcharge is waived.

No Violent Contact with Sydney K. Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any Mental Health treatment or counseling.    Follow through with any AODA treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Review/Modification Requested/Recommended from Department of Corrections.

Defendant Siddique A Qureshi in court, in custody, with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 4 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years). Credit for 151 days.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge waived. 
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Follow through with Mental Health treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No violent contact with Sydney K.
Department of Corrections requesting an extension of the due date for the Presentence Investigation. Approved by the Court, PSI due to the Court by October 31, 2014.
Sentencing hearing on November 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Siddique A Qureshi in court, in custody, with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 14CF488 dismissed and read in to this matter and to 13CM1913 and 13CM2089.  Defense requests adjourned sentencing.  Court orders bail revoked.  Court orders Presentence Investigation to be completed and report filed within 30 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
